summary: Hey can someone out there let Chris Evans know, for me, that I hope he has a great night? Robert? Is that you Robert? I see you...
body:
Hey can someone out there let Chris Evans know, for me, that I hope he has a great night?

Robert? Is that you Robert? I see you lurking. Yes, you. Do this for me will you?

Or…someone.

summary: Honestly anyone who says DC movies are better than Marvel is just lying to themselves
body:
Honestly anyone who says DC movies are better than Marvel is just lying to themselves

Sure, if we’re talking the first Iron Man movie verse the Dark Knight trilogy, then let the debate begin. But over the course of the last 10 years, Marvel has stopped making stereotypical hero trope stories and began making masterpieces while DC kept the same story arc with different characters (excluding Wonder Woman, of course). Anyone who thinks otherwise, look at the facts and fight me:

  1. Black Panther not only broke through every racial barrier that existed in the genre, but it did so while also providing wonderful commentary on how the world treats poverty and provided some of the most awe-inducing cinematography we’ve seen this decade.
  2. Thanos is the most well-developed villain in the history of cinema, imo. He was ruthless in his intentions but also remained so identifiably human that the audience could empathize with his journey and his past while also wholeheartedly rooting for him to lose. Marvel presented him as a man with so much to lose, but willing to throw it all away because he knew the outcome was far more impprtant and he was strong enough to live with the consequences, even if no one would thank him for it.
  3. Tony Stark started as a billionaire with a shiny suit, flying around and saving people to boost his popularity. Until Ultron destroyed a city and everything clicked. He spent his whole life bending or ignoring every rule he was supposed to follow, and the weight of every decision he made up until he made Ultron suddenly dropped onto his shoulders and crushed him into a shell of his old self. His Utilitarianism mindset flipped completely into overwhelming guilt for anyone he had ever caused harm to. He was for the Sokovia Accords because he knew he couldn’t trust himself to make the right call anymore. Steve Rogers has morality pumping through his veins, it’s part of what makes him super, but Tony knew he didn’t have that sense and his crippling fear of messing up again manifested into his full support of the Accords and not even his friendship with Cap could get in his way.
  4. Marvel stopped making superhero movies a while ago. Now their movies are legitimately works of art. Works of cinema that explore what it means to be human and to have something to lose. They use stunning visuals and expert metaphors to expand our knowledge of human suffering and power, but sure, Batman incessantly whining about being a rich orphan is important too.

Marvel presented him as a man with so much to lose, but willing to throw it all away because he knew the outcome was far more impprtant and he was strong enough to live with the consequences, even if no one would thank him for it.
  3. Tony Stark started as a billionaire with a shiny suit, flying around and saving people to boost his popularity. Until Ultron destroyed a city and everything clicked. blog.name: ao3feed-tonystark
blog.title: Ao3-Feed: Tony Stark
blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

title: Love Comes Wearing Disguises
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2PkPgue

by Mahla

New York is in shambles, and so are the Avengers. Tony’s had enough of SHIELD’s schemes and decides to quit, which is bad news for Fury, since SHIELD could use his expertise in the face of new rising threats. When Thor returns to Earth with a weakened Loki in tow and orders from Odin, Fury gets a brilliant idea… a plan involving Loki, magic, seduction, fake business transactions, and so, so many lies.

But maybe there is a bit of truth in the mix, as a certain God of Mischief and a Man of Iron are about to realise.

Words: 3269, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: The Avengers (Marvel Movies), Marvel
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: F/M, M/M
  • Characters: Loki (Marvel), Tony Stark, Steve Rogers, Bruce Banner, Phil Coulson, Nick Fury, Natasha Romanov (Marvel), Clint Barton, Thor (Marvel), Victor von Doom, Amora (Marvel), Odin (Marvel), Frigga (Marvel)
  • Relationships: Loki/Tony Stark
  • Additional Tags: Slow Burn, Deception, FrostIron - Freeform, Lady Loki, Post-Avengers (2012), all the lies, Doombots, Loki helps, Romance, Developing Relationship, Light Angst, Magic, avenger!loki, Nick Fury Lies, Nick Fury is Not Amused, thor tries his best, Loki hates them all, SHIELD, questionable morals, Secrets, Tony Stark Has A Heart, Tony Stark Needs a Hug, Pepper Potts & Tony Stark Friendship, Drama & Romance, Light-Hearted, with some feels, Action, Coulson Lives

blog.name: ao3feed-tonystark
blog.title: Ao3-Feed: Tony Stark
blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

summary: It's Always Your Eyes That Pull Me Under
title: It's Always Your Eyes That Pull Me Under
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2PpdXFT

by Violette_Pleasures

If life were an eighties teen rom-com, then this was his Jake waiting for Sam outside the church Sixteen Candles, Lloyd holding a boombox for Diane Say Anything moment.
There stood Tony Stark, leaning back against his cherry red Audi, legs crossed at the ankles, one hand in his pocket and in the other was a dozen, no two, heck, maybe three or four dozen bright red roses. He’s wearing one of his designer suits that shone like satin with rose tinted glasses and a grin that could make anyone’s heart stop. In fact, maybe Peter should check his pulse right now.

Peter has finally graduated but the victory is sort of short lived because Aunt May can tell something is up between him and Tony.
or
The one where Peter confesses and shares his fears and worries with his best friends

Words: 8016, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

Series: Part 5 of I Love You More Than I Can Promise

  • Fandoms: Spider-Man: Homecoming (2017), Iron Man (Movies), The Avengers (Marvel Movies)
  • Rating: Explicit
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: M/M

by Violette_Pleasures

If life were an eighties teen rom-com, then this was his Jake waiting for Sam outside the church Sixteen Candles, Lloyd holding a boombox for Diane Say Anything moment.
There stood Tony Stark, leaning back against his cherry red Audi, legs crossed at the ankles, one hand in his pocket and in the other was a dozen, no two, heck, maybe three or four dozen bright red roses. He’s wearing one of his designer suits that shone like satin with rose tinted glasses and a grin that could make anyone’s heart stop. In fact, maybe Peter should check his pulse right now.

Peter has finally graduated but the victory is sort of short lived because Aunt May can tell something is up between him and Tony.
or
The one where Peter confesses and shares his fears and worries with his best friends

blog.title: JUST ME AND TONS OF FEELS
blog.description: Hi there! My name is Silvia. I'm a telefilm addicted and this is just a blog about my favorite shows and my OTPs

summary: Watching the ‘Earth just lost her best defender’scene
title: Watching the ‘Earth just lost her best defender’scene
body:
Cap: I’m not looking for forgiveness..

Me:That’s right!!!You hurt my Tony! I’ll never forgive you! You hypocrite!!

Cap: ..Earth just lost her best defender

Me: Aww. Oh my god!! Oh damn!! I think I just forgave him..

blog.name: ao3feed-tonystark
blog.title: Ao3-Feed: Tony Stark
blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

title: concrete angel
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2PWPau3

by parkrstark

A teacher discovers Peter’s secret and decides to use it against him in the worst way. Tony finds out and he’s furious.

Written for the prompt: after A4 Peter is at school adjusting to life after being dead and he gets a new teacher named Mr Westcott who takes special interest in him; He happens to find out Peter’s secret identity (because we know Peter’s not as careful as he could be about it sometimes, like jumping over school fences) and tells Peter that he won’t tell anyone as long as Spider-Man does some favors for him… etc.

Words: 2967, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Spider-Man: Homecoming (2017), Marvel Cinematic Universe
  • Rating: Mature
  • Warnings: Rape/Non-Con, Underage
  • Categories: Gen, M/M
  • Characters: Peter Parker, Tony Stark, Skip Westcott
  • Relationships: Peter Parker & Tony Stark, Peter Parker/Skip Westcott
  • Additional Tags: Post-Avengers: Infinity War Part 1 (Movie), Blackmail, Implied/Referenced Rape/Non-con, Hurt/Comfort, Protective Tony Stark


read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2PWPau3
